intro: Eritrichium sinomicrocarpum, commonly known as the Chinese microcarp eritrichium, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The plant is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that typically bloom in early spring. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and covered in fine hairs. It is often found in rocky or sandy soils in alpine regions.
